bitfield.description: Enable the power
Clear the RESETSTKY bit in the STAT register
Assert reset to the peripheral
Async Clock Request is blocked from starting SYSOSC or forcing bus clock to 32MHz
This bit indicates, if the peripheral was reset, since this bit was cleared by RESETSTKYCLR in the RSTCTL register

bitenum.description: The peripheral has not been reset since this bit was last cleared by RESETSTKYCLR in the RSTCTL register
The peripheral was reset since the last bit clear

bitfield.description: Selects divide ratio of module clock

register.description: Clock Select for Ultra Low Power peripherals

bitfield.description: Selects MFCLK as clock source if enabled

bitenum.description: Does not select this clock as a source
Select this clock as a source

bitfield.description: Selects BUS CLK as clock source if enabled

bitenum.description: Does not select this clock as a source
Select this clock as a source

bitfield.description: Selects LFCLK as clock source if enabled

bitenum.description: Does not select this clock as a source
Select this clock as a source

bitfield.description: Free run control

bitenum.description: The peripheral freezes functionality while the Core Halted input is asserted and resumes when it is deasserted.
The peripheral ignores the state of the Core Halted input

bitfield.description: Soft halt boundary control. This function is only available, if [FREE] is set to 'STOP'

bitenum.description: The peripheral will halt immediately, even if the resultant state will result in corruption if the system is restarted
The peripheral blocks the debug freeze until it has reached a boundary where it can resume without corruption

bitfield.description: UART Module Interrupt Vector Value. This register provides the highes priority interrupt index. A read clears the corresponding interrupt flag in RIS and MIS registers. 15h-1Fh = Reserved

bitenum.description: UART receive time-out interrupt; Interrupt Flag: RT; Interrupt Priority: Highest
UART framing error interrupt; Interrupt Flag: FE
UART parity error interrupt; Interrupt Flag: PE
UART break error interrupt; Interrupt Flag: BE
UART receive overrun error interrupt; Interrupt Flag: OE
Negative edge on UARTxRXD interrupt; Interrupt Flag: RXNE
Positive edge on UARTxRXD interrupt; Interrupt Flag: RXPE
LIN capture 0 / match interrupt; Interrupt Flag: LINC0
LIN capture 1 interrupt; Interrupt Flag: LINC1
LIN hardware counter overflow interrupt; Interrupt Flag: LINOVF
UART receive interrupt; Interrupt Flag: RX
UART transmit interrupt; Interrupt Flag: TX
UART end of transmission interrupt (transmit serializer empty); Interrupt Flag: EOT
9-bit mode address match interrupt; Interrupt Flag: MODE_9B
UART Clear to Send Modem interrupt; Interrupt Flag: CTS

UART Module Interrupt Vector Value. This register provides the highes priority interrupt index. A read clears the corresponding interrupt flag in UARTRIS and UARTMISC. 15h-1Fh = Reserved

bitenum.description: UART receive time-out interrupt; Interrupt Flag: RT; Interrupt Priority: Highest
UART receive interrupt; Interrupt Flag: RX

Enable UART Receive Interrupt.

UART Module Interrupt Vector Value. This register provides the highes priority interrupt index. A read clears the corresponding interrupt flag in UARTRIS and UARTMISC. 15h-1Fh = Reserved

bitenum.description: UART transmit interrupt; Interrupt Flag: TX

bitfield.description: Enable UART Transmit Interrupt.
UART Transmit Interrupt.
Masked UART Transmit Interrupt.
Set UART Transmit Interrupt.
Clear UART Transmit Interrupt.
Event line mode select for event corresponding to [IPSTANDARD.INT_EVENT0]

bitenum.description: The interrupt or event line is disabled.
The interrupt or event line is in software mode. Software must clear the RIS.
The interrupt or event line is in hardware mode. The hardware (another module) clears automatically the associated RIS flag.

bitfield.description: Event line mode select for event corresponding to [IPSTANDARD.INT_EVENT1]

bitenum.description: The interrupt or event line is disabled.
The interrupt or event line is in software mode. Software must clear the RIS.
The interrupt or event line is in hardware mode. The hardware (another module) clears automatically the associated RIS flag.

bitfield.description: Event line mode select for event corresponding to [IPSTANDARD.INT_EVENT2]

bitenum.description: The interrupt or event line is disabled.
The interrupt or event line is in software mode. Software must clear the RIS.
The interrupt or event line is in hardware mode. The hardware (another module) clears automatically the associated RIS flag.

bitfield.description: Writing a 1 to this field re-evaluates the interrupt sources.

bitenum.description: The interrupt or event line is disabled.
The interrupt or event line is in software mode. Software must clear the RIS.

bitfield.description: UART Module Enable. If the UART is disabled in the middle of transmission or reception, it completes the current character before stopping. If the ENABLE bit is not set, all registers can still be accessed and updated. It is recommended to setup and change the UART operation mode with having the ENABLE bit cleared to avoid unpredictable behavior during the setup or update. If disabled the UART module will not send or receive any data and the logic is held in reset state.

High-Speed Bit Oversampling Enable #b#NOTE:#/b# The bit oversampling influences the UART baud-rate configuration. The state of this bit has no effect on clock generation in ISO7816 smart card mode (the SMART bit is set).

bitenum.description: 3x oversampling. IrDA, Manchester and DALI not supported when 3x oversampling is enabled.

bitfield.description: UART Loop Back Enable

bitenum.description: The UARTxTX path is fed through the UARTxRX path internally.

bitfield.description: UART Receive Enable If the UART is disabled in the middle of a receive, it completes the current character before stopping. #b#NOTE:#/b# To enable reception, the UARTEN bit must be set.

bitenum.description: The receive section of the UART is disabled.
The receive section of the UART is enabled.

bitfield.description: UART Transmit Enable If the UART is disabled in the middle of a transmission, it completes the current character before stopping. #b#NOTE:#/b# To enable transmission, the UARTEN bit must be set.

bitenum.description: The transmit section of the UART is disabled. The UARTxTXD pin of the UART can be controlled by the TXD_CTL bit when enabled.
The transmit section of the UART is enabled.

bitfield.description: Request to Send If RTSEN is set the RTS output signals is controlled by the hardware logic using the FIFO fill level or TXDATA buffer. If RTSEN is cleared the RTS output is controlled by the RTS bit. The bit is the complement of the UART request to send, RTS modem status output.
Enable hardware controlled Request to Send

bitenum.description: RTS hardware flow control is disabled.
RTS hardware flow control is enabled. Data is only requested (by asserting UARTxRTS) when the receive FIFO has available entries.

bitfield.description: Enable Clear To Send

bitenum.description: CTS hardware flow control is disabled.
CTS hardware flow control is enabled. Data is only transmitted when the UARTxCTS signal is asserted.

bitfield.description: Set the communication mode and protocol used. (Not defined settings uses the default setting: 0)

bitenum.description: RS485 mode: UART needs to be IDLE with receiving data for the in EXTDIR_HOLD set time. EXTDIR_SETUP defines the time the RTS line is set to high before sending. When the buffer is empty the RTS line is set low again. A transmit will be delayed as long the UART is receiving data.
The UART operates in IDLE Line Mode
The UART operates in 9 Bit Address mode

ISO7816 Smart Card Support The application must ensure that it sets 8-bit word length (WLEN set to 3h) and even parity (PEN set to 1, EPS set to 1, SPS set to 0) in UARTLCRH when using ISO7816 mode. The value of the STP2 bit in UARTLCRH is ignored and the number of stop bits is forced to 2.

bitfield.description: UART Enable FIFOs

bitenum.description: The FIFOs are disabled (Character mode). The FIFOs become 1-byte-deep holding registers.
The transmit and receive FIFO buffers are enabled (FIFO mode).

bitfield.description: TXD Pin Control Controls the TXD pin when TXD_OUT_EN = 1 and TXE = 0.
TXD Pin Control Enable. When the transmit section of the UART is disabled (TXE = 0), the TXD pin can be controlled by the TXD_OUT bit.

bitenum.description: TXD pin can not be controlled by TXD_OUT
TXD pin can be controlled by TXD_OUT

bitfield.description:
Majority Vote Enable
When Majority Voting is enabled, the three center bits are used to determine received sample value. In case of error (i.e. all 3 bits are not the same), noise error is detected and bits RIS.NERR and register RXDATA.NERR are set. Oversampling of 16 : bits 7, 8, 9 are used Oversampling of 8 : bits 3, 4, 5 are used Disabled : Single sample value (center value) used

Most Significant Bit First This bit has effect both on the way protocol byte is transmitted and received. Notes: User needs to match the protocol to the correct value of this bit to send MSb or LSb first. The hardware engine will send the byte entirely based on this bit.

bitenum.description: Least significant bit is sent first in the protocol packet
Most significant bit is sent first in the protocol packet

bitfield.description: UART Send Break (for LIN Protocol)

bitenum.description: A low level is continually output on the UARTxTXD signal, after completing transmission of the current character. For the proper execution of the break command, software must set this bit for at least two frames (character periods).

bitfield.description: UART Parity Enable

bitenum.description: Parity is disabled and no parity bit is added to the data frame.
Parity checking and generation is enabled.

bitfield.description: UART Even Parity Select This bit has no effect when parity is disabled by the PEN bit. For 9-Bit UART Mode transmissions, this bit controls the address byte and data byte indication (9th bit). 0 = The transferred byte is a data byte 1 = The transferred byte is an address byte

bitenum.description: Odd parity is performed, which checks for an odd number of 1s.
Even parity generation and checking is performed during transmission and reception, which checks for an even number of 1s in data and parity bits.

bitfield.description: UART Two Stop Bits Select When in 7816 smart card mode (the SMART bit is set in the UARTCTL register), the number of stop bits is forced to 2.

bitenum.description: One stop bit is transmitted at the end of a frame.
Two stop bits are transmitted at the end of a frame. The receive logic checks for two stop bits being received and provide Frame Error if either is invalid.

bitfield.description: UART Word Length The bits indicate the number of data bits transmitted or received in a frame as follows:

UART Stick Parity Select The Stick Parity Select (SPS) bit is used to set either a permanent '1' or a permanent '0' as parity when transmitting or receiving data. Its purpose is to typically indicate the first byte of a package or to mark an address byte, for example in a multi-drop RS-485 network.
When bits PEN, EPS, and SPS of UARTLCRH are set, the parity bit is transmitted and checked as a 0. When bits PEN and SPS are set and EPS is cleared, the parity bit is transmitted and checked as a 1.
UART send IDLE pattern. When this bit is set an SENDIDLE period of 11 bit times will be sent on the TX line. The bit is cleared by hardware afterwards.
Defines the number of UARTclk ticks the signal to control the external driver for the RS485 will be set before the START bit is send

Defines the number of UARTclk ticks the signal to control the external driver for the RS485 will be reset after the beginning of the stop bit. (If 2 STOP bits are enabled the beginning of the 2nd STOP bit.)

UART Busy This bit is set as soon as the transmit FIFO or TXDATA register becomes non-empty (regardless of whether UART is enabled) or if a receive data is currently ongoing (after the start edge have been detected until a complete byte, including all stop bits, has been received by the shift register). In IDLE_Line mode the Busy signal also stays set during the idle time generation.

bitenum.description: The UART is busy transmitting data. This bit remains set until the complete byte, including all stop bits, has been sent/received from/into the shift register.

bitfield.description: UART Transmit FIFO Full The meaning of this bit depends on the state of the FEN bit in the CTL0 register.

bitenum.description: If the FIFO is disabled (FEN is 0), the transmit holding register is full. If the FIFO is enabled (FEN is 1), the transmit FIFO is full.

bitfield.description: UART Receive FIFO Full The meaning of this bit depends on the state of the FEN bit in the CTL0 register.

bitenum.description: If the FIFO is disabled (FEN is 0), the receive holding register is full. If the FIFO is enabled (FEN is 1), the receive FIFO is full.

bitfield.description: UART Transmit FIFO Empty The meaning of this bit depends on the state of the FEN bit in the CTL0 register.

bitenum.description: The transmitter has data to transmit.
If the FIFO is disabled (FEN is 0), the transmit holding register is empty. If the FIFO is enabled (FEN is 1), the transmit FIFO is empty.

bitfield.description: Clear To Send

bitenum.description: The CTS signal is not asserted (high).

bitfield.description: IDLE mode has been detected in Idleline-Multiprocessor-Mode. The IDLE bit is used as an address tag for each block of characters. In idle-line multiprocessor format, this bit is set when a received character is an address.

bitenum.description: IDLE has not been detected before last received character. (In idle-line multiprocessor mode).
IDLE has been detected before last received character. (In idle-line multiprocessor mode).

bitfield.description: UART Receive FIFO Empty The meaning of this bit depends on the state of the FEN bit in the CTL0 register.

bitenum.description: If the FIFO is disabled (FEN is 0), the receive holding register is empty. If the FIFO is enabled (FEN is 1), the receive FIFO is empty.

register.description: UART Interrupt FIFO Level Select Register

bitfield.description: UART Transmit Interrupt FIFO Level Select The trigger points for the transmit interrupt are as follows: Note: for undefined settings the default configuration is used.

bitenum.description: TX FIFO >= 1 entry free Note: esp. required for DMA Trigger

bitfield.description:
UART Receive Interrupt FIFO Level Select The trigger points for the receive interrupt are as follows:
Note: In ULP domain the trigger levels are used for: 0: LVL_1_4 4: LVL_FULL For undefined settings the default configuration is used.

bitenum.description: RX FIFO >= 1/4 full Note: For ULP Domain
RX FIFO is full Note: For ULP Domain
RX FIFO >= 1 entry available Note: esp. required for DMA Trigger

bitfield.description: UART Receive Interrupt Timeout Select. When receiving no start edge for an additional character within the set bittimes a RX interrupt is set even if the FIFO level is not reached. A value of 0 disables this function.
Integer Baud-Rate Divisor
Fractional Baud-Rate Divisor
Analog Glitch Suppression Pulse Width This field controls the pulse width select for the analog glitch suppression on the RX line. See device datasheet for exact values.

bitenum.description: Pulses shorter then 5ns length are filtered.
Pulses shorter then 10ns length are filtered.
Pulses shorter then 25ns length are filtered.
Pulses shorter then 50ns length are filtered.

bitfield.description: Analog Glitch Suppression Enable
Data Transmitted or Received Data that is to be transmitted via the UART is written to this field. When read, this field contains the data that was received by the UART.
Received Data. When read, this field contains the data that was received by the UART.

UART Framing Error Writing to this bit has no effect. The flag is cleared by writing 1 to the FRMERR bit in the UART EVENT ICLR register. This error is associated with the character at the top of the FIFO.

bitenum.description: The received character does not have a valid stop bit sequence, which is one or two stop bits depending on the UARTLCRH.STP2 setting (a valid stop bit is 1).

bitfield.description: UART Parity Error Writing to this bit has no effect. The flag is cleared by writing 1 to the PARERR bit in the UART EVENT ICLR register.

bitenum.description: The parity of the received data character does not match the parity defined by bits 2 and 7 of the UARTLCRH register.

bitfield.description: UART Break Error Writing to this bit has no effect. The flag is cleared by writing 1 to the BRKERR bit in the UART EVENT ICLR register. This error is associated with the character at the top of the FIFO. When a break occurs, only one 0 character is loaded into the FIFO. The next character is only enabled after the receive data input goes to a 1 (marking state) and the next valid start bit is received.

bitenum.description: A break condition has been detected, indicating that the receive data input was held low for longer than a full-word transmission time (defined as start, data, parity, and stop bits).

bitfield.description: UART Receive Overrun Error Writing to this bit has no effect. The flag is cleared by writing 1 to the OVRERR bit in the UART EVENT ICLR register. In case of a receive FIFO overflow, the FIFO contents remain valid because no further data is written when the FIFO is full. Only the contents of the shift register are overwritten. The CPU must read the data in order to empty the FIFO.

bitenum.description: No data has been lost due to a receive overrun.
New data was received but could not be stored, because the previous data was not read (resulting in data loss).

bitfield.description: Noise Error. Writing to this bit has no effect. The flag is cleared by writing 1 to the NERR bit in the UART EVENT ICLR register.

bitenum.description: Noise error occured during majority voting

bitfield.description: Self Address Mask for 9-Bit Mode This field contains the address mask that creates a set of addresses that should be matched. A 0 bit in the MSK bitfield configures, that the corresponding bit in the ADDR bitfield of the UARTxADDR register is don't care. A 1 bit in the MSK bitfield configures, that the corresponding bit in the ADDR bitfield of the UARTxADDR register must match.
Self Address for 9-Bit Mode This field contains the address that should be matched when UARTxAMASK is FFh.
